title: How to Make Potato Salad for 50 People

steps.title: Leaving the skins on, cook the potatoes in salted water until easily pierced with a fork.
steps.content: Leaving the skins on, cook the potatoes in salted water until easily pierced with a fork. The skins may split, which is fine. You can cook in batches. [1] X Research source Choose potatoes roughly all the same size for even cooking. You can cut larger potatoes in half before cooking.

steps.title: Drain water off the potatoes once cooked.
steps.content: Drain water off the potatoes once cooked.

steps.title: Set the potatoes onto a cookie sheet to cool slightly.
steps.content: Set the potatoes onto a cookie sheet to cool slightly. You can cool them on the counter or in the refrigerator.

steps.title: When potatoes are still warm, peel them.
steps.content: When potatoes are still warm, peel them. [2] X Research source If you like the skins on, skip peeling them and just cube them.

steps.title: Cut the peeled potatoes into uniform cubes measuring about 3/4 of an inch.
steps.content: Cut the peeled potatoes into uniform cubes measuring about 3/4 of an inch. Salt and pepper the cubed potatoes lightly.

steps.title: Place the cubes into large bowl.
steps.content: Place the cubes into large bowl.

steps.title: In a separate large bowl, add all of the remaining ingredients except for the eggs and milk.
steps.content: In a separate large bowl, add all of the remaining ingredients except for the eggs and milk. Mix well. Feel free to use a little less onions, if you'd like. You can use mayonnaise instead of Miracle Whip.

steps.title: Add the milk and mix again.
steps.content: Add the milk and mix again. The milk thins out the dressing so that is easier to spread.

steps.title: Add the chopped eggs to the potatoes.
steps.content: Add the chopped eggs to the potatoes. Fold them in gently to mix the potato and egg mixture together.

steps.title: Add the dressing.
steps.content: Add the dressing. Stir gently to coat the potatoes and eggs with it. Try not to break up the potatoes too much. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Store the potato salad at a cool temperature, between 35-40 degrees/1.6-4.4ºC.
steps.content: Store the potato salad at a cool temperature, between 35-40 degrees/1.6-4.4ºC. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Serve in one large bowl or several small ones.
steps.content: Serve in one large bowl or several small ones. [5] X Research source You can serve this dish over ice to keep it cold. Place a slightly larger bowl with ice in it under the bowl of potato salad.
